recipes.ingredients: 2 cups cooked chicken breast, diced, 1 ripe avocado, diced, 1 medium cucumber, diced, 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved, 1/4 cup diced red onion, 2 tablespoons chopped cilantro, Juice of 1 lime, 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon cumin, Salt and pepper to taste, 1/4 teaspoon chili flakes (optional)
recipes.directions: In a large bowl, combine the diced chicken, avocado, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, and red onion. Sprinkle with chopped cilantro, In a small bowl, whisk together lime juice, olive oil, cumin, salt, pepper, and chili flakes if using. Pour the dressing over the salad and gently toss to coat all the ingredients evenly. Adjust seasoning to taste, Serve immediately or chill in the refrigerator for 30 minutes before serving for flavors to meld.

recipes.ingredients: 4 large bell peppers (any color), 1 cup quinoa (uncooked), 2 cups low-sodium vegetable broth, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 medium onion, chopped, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 zucchini, diced, 1 cup black beans, drained and rinsed, 1 cup corn kernels, fresh or frozen and thawed, 1 teaspoon chili powder, 1 teaspoon cumin, 1/2 teaspoon paprika, Salt and pepper, to taste, 1/2 cup grated low-fat cheddar cheese, Fresh cilantro or parsley for garnish
recipes.directions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Cut the tops off peppers and remove seeds and membranes. Bring the vegetable broth to a boil in a medium pot. Stir in quinoa, cover, and reduce heat to low. Cook for 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat and set aside,  Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and sauté until translucent. Add zucchini, black beans, and corn and cook for another 5 minutes. Add the cooked quinoa to the skillet and mix in chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. Stir well to combine,  Stuff each bell pepper with the quinoa mixture and place in a baking dish. Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 25 minutes. Remove foil, sprinkle each pepper with cheese, and bake uncovered for another 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the peppers are tender. Garnish with fresh cilantro or parsley before serving.

recipes.recipe_name: Scrambled Tofu with Spinach and Tomato
recipes.ingredients: 1 block (14 ounces) firm tofu, drained and crumbled,2 cups fresh spinach,1 medium tomato, diced,1/2 tablespoon olive oil,1/4 teaspoon turmeric,1/2 teaspoon garlic powder,1/2 teaspoon onion powder,Salt and pepper to taste
recipes.directions: Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat and add the olive oil. Add crumbled tofu and cook for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally.,Sprinkle turmeric, garlic powder, and onion powder over the tofu and continue to cook for another 2 minutes.,Add the fresh spinach and diced tomato to the skillet, and cook until the spinach is wilted, which should take about 2-3 minutes.,Season with salt and pepper according to your taste preferences. Serve hot.

recipes.ingredients: 1 cup quinoa, rinsed,2 cups water,1 can (15 oz) chickpeas, drained and rinsed,1 medium cucumber, diced,1 red bell pepper, diced,1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped,1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved,1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley,1/4 cup lemon juice,2 tablespoons olive oil,1 garlic clove, minced,1/2 teaspoon ground cumin,Salt and pepper to taste,4 wide-mouth pint-sized mason jars
recipes.directions: In a medium saucepan, combine quinoa and water. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, and cover. Cook for 15 minutes, or until water is absorbed. Remove from heat and let it stand for 5 minutes, then fluff with a fork and let cool.,In a large bowl, mix together the cooled quinoa, chickpeas, cucumber, red bell pepper, red onion, cherry tomatoes, and parsley.,In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, olive oil, minced garlic, cumin, salt, and pepper to create the dressing.,Divide the dressing evenly between the 4 mason jars. Layer the quinoa salad mixture on top of the dressing.,Seal the jars and refrigerate until ready to eat. Shake well before eating to distribute the dressing throughout the salad.

recipes.ingredients: 6 egg whites,2 whole eggs,1 cup fresh spinach, washed and chopped,1/2 cup mushrooms, sliced,1/4 cup onions, chopped,1 clove garlic, minced,1/4 cup reduced-fat feta cheese,1/2 teaspoon dried oregano,1/4 teaspoon salt,1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper,1 tablespoon olive oil
recipes.directions: Preheat your oven to 350 F.,In a mixing bowl, whisk together the egg whites, whole eggs, oregano, salt, and black pepper.,Heat olive oil in a 10-inch ovenproof skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and garlic, sautéing until they are softened.,Add mushrooms and cook until they are browned and their moisture has evaporated.,Stir in the spinach and cook until it's wilted.,Pour the egg mixture over the vegetables in the skillet. Cook for a couple of minutes until the eggs start to set at the edges.,Sprinkle the top with feta cheese.,Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 10-15 minutes, or until the frittata is firm in the center.,Remove from the oven and let it sit for a few minutes before cutting into wedges and serving.

recipes.recipe_name: Stuffed Bell Peppers with Quinoa and Black Beans
recipes.ingredients: 4 large bell peppers, tops cut away and seeds removed,1 cup uncooked quinoa, rinsed,1 tablespoon olive oil,1 medium onion, diced,2 cloves garlic, minced,1 teaspoon ground cumin,1 teaspoon chili powder,1 can (15 ounces) black beans, drained and rinsed,1 cup frozen corn kernels, thawed,1 cup low-sodium vegetable broth,1/2 cup shredded reduced-fat cheddar cheese,1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro,Salt and pepper to taste,Lime wedges for serving
recipes.directions: Preheat oven to 375 F. Place the bell peppers cut-side up in a baking dish; set aside.,In a medium pot, cook quinoa according to package instructions using vegetable broth instead of water.,Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic, and sauté until soft. Stir in the ground cumin and chili powder and cook for another minute.,Stir the sautéed onion mixture into the cooked quinoa. Add the black beans, corn, half the cheese, cilantro, salt, and pepper. Mix well.,Spoon the quinoa mixture into each bell pepper cavity. Top with the remaining cheese.,Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake for 30 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for another 10 minutes or until the peppers are tender and the cheese is melted and lightly browned.,Serve with lime wedges on the side.

recipes.ingredients: 2 cups chickpeas, drained and rinsed,1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved,1 cucumber, diced,1/2 red onion, finely chopped,1/4 cup kalamata olives, sliced,1/4 cup feta cheese, crumbled,2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil,1 tablespoon red wine vinegar,1/2 teaspoon dried oregano,1/2 teaspoon dried basil,Salt and pepper to taste,1 tablespoon fresh parsley, chopped
recipes.directions: In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and kalamata olives. Gently mix.,In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat evenly.,Sprinkle crumbled feta cheese and fresh parsley over the top of the salad. Toss lightly once more before serving. Can be served immediately or chilled for an hour to allow flavors to meld.

recipes.ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts (6 ounces each),1 tablespoon olive oil,2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice,1 garlic clove, minced,1 teaspoon dried oregano,1/4 teaspoon black pepper,4 cups mixed salad greens,1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved,1 small cucumber, sliced,1/4 red onion, thinly sliced,1/4 cup feta cheese, crumbled,1/4 cup Kalamata olives, pitted,2 tablespoons red wine vinegar,1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil,1/2 teaspoon Dijon mustard
recipes.directions: Preheat grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.,Whisk together 1 tablespoon olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, oregano, and black pepper in a bowl. Add the chicken breasts, coating them well with the marinade. Let them marinate for at least 20 minutes.,Grill the chicken for 6-7 minutes per side or until cooked through and no longer pink in the center. Remove from grill and let rest before slicing.,In a large salad bowl, toss together the mixed greens, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and red onion. Top with sliced grilled chicken, feta cheese, and Kalamata olives.,To prepare the dressing, whisk together red wine vinegar, extra-virgin olive oil, and Dijon mustard until emulsified. Drizzle dressing over the salad and gently toss to combine.

recipes.ingredients: 6 large eggs, 1/4 cup non-fat milk, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 2 cups sliced mushrooms, 2 cups fresh spinach, 1 small onion, diced, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1/2 cup shredded low-fat cheddar cheese, Fresh herbs (like parsley or chives), chopped, for garnish
recipes.directions: Preheat the oven to 375 F. In a bowl, whisk together eggs, non-fat milk, salt, and pepper until well combined. Set aside.,In a 10-inch oven-proof skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the onions and mushrooms and sauté until the onions are translucent and mushrooms are browned, about 5-7 minutes.,Add spinach to the skillet and cook until just wilted, about 1-2 minutes. Spread the veggies evenly across the bottom of the skillet.,Pour the egg mixture over the veggies, covering them evenly. Sprinkle the shredded cheese on top. Let cook without stirring for about 4-5 minutes until the eggs start to set.,Place the skillet in the oven and bake for 12-15 minutes, or until frittata is puffed and golden, and a knife inserted in the center comes out clean.,Garnish with fresh herbs before serving. Cut into wedges and serve warm.

recipes.ingredients: 1 cup almond flour, 2 large eggs, 1/4 cup water (for thinner pancakes, you can add more), 1 tablespoon oil (coconut or olive oil), 1 teaspoon baking powder, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 tablespoons granulated sweetener of choice (e.g., erythritol or monk fruit for a low glycemic impact), Non-stick cooking spray or additional oil for cooking, Fresh berries or sugar-free syrup for serving (optional)
recipes.directions: In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together the almond flour, baking powder, sweetener, and salt. In another bowl, beat the eggs, then add the water, oil, and vanilla extract and mix well. Combine the wet and dry ingredients until you achieve a smooth batter, Heat a non-stick skillet or griddle over medium heat and lightly coat with cooking spray or a little oil. Pour 1/4 cup of the batter onto the skillet for each pancake. Cook until the edges are set and bubbles form on the surface, about 2 to 3 minutes, then flip and cook the other side for an additional 1 to 2 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. Serve warm with your choice of diabetic-friendly toppings like fresh berries or sugar-free syrup.

recipes.ingredients: 1 cup unsweetened almond milk,1/2 cup Greek yogurt (low-fat, no added sugar),3/4 cup frozen blueberries,1 tablespoon almond butter,1 tablespoon chia seeds,1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract,2 teaspoons erythritol or stevia to taste (optional),Ice cubes (as needed)
recipes.directions: In a blender, combine the almond milk, Greek yogurt, frozen blueberries, almond butter, chia seeds, vanilla extract, and your choice of erythritol or stevia if additional sweetness is desired.,Blend on high until the mixture is smooth. Add ice cubes until you reach the desired consistency.,Pour the smoothie into a glass and enjoy immediately.

recipes.ingredients: 1 can (15 ounces) chickpeas, drained and rinsed,1 can (5 ounces) tuna in water, drained,1 medium red bell pepper, diced,1/2 cucumber, diced,1/4 red onion, thinly sliced,2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley,1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil,1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice,1/2 teaspoon dried oregano,Salt and pepper to taste
recipes.directions: In a large bowl, combine the chickpeas, tuna, diced red bell pepper, diced cucumber, and sliced red onion. Toss well to mix.,In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, dried oregano, salt, and pepper to create a dressing.,Pour the dressing over the salad and toss again to coat everything evenly. Sprinkle with chopped parsley and gently mix.,Allow the salad to sit for about 10 minutes before serving to let the flavors marry. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

recipes.ingredients: 4 large bell peppers (any color), 1 pound ground turkey, 1 cup cooked quinoa, 1 (14.5-ounce) can no-salt-added diced tomatoes, drained, 1 cup chopped onions, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 teaspoon smoked paprika, 1 teaspoon dried oregano, 1/2 teaspoon cumin, 1/2 teaspoon chili powder, 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, 1 cup shredded reduced-fat cheddar cheese, 1/2 cup low-sodium chicken broth, Fresh parsley for garnish
recipes.directions: Preheat oven to 350 F. Cut tops off bell peppers and remove seeds and membranes; set aside. In a skillet over medium heat, cook ground turkey, onions, and garlic until meat is no longer pink and onions are translucent. Drain any excess fat.,Stir in cooked quinoa, diced tomatoes, smoked paprika, oregano, cumin, chili powder, and black pepper into the skillet with the turkey. Cook for an additional 5 minutes.,Spoon the mixture into each bell pepper cavity and place them in a baking dish. Pour chicken broth into the bottom of the dish. Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 35 minutes.,Uncover, sprinkle with cheese, and bake for another 10 minutes until the cheese is melted and peppers are tender. Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

recipes.ingredients: 8 large eggs, 1/2 cup milk (preferably almond or skim), 2 cups baby spinach, 1 cup sliced mushrooms, 1 medium onion, diced, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano, 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 1 tablespoon olive oil
recipes.directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, salt, pepper, and oregano. Set aside, Heat olive oil in a 10-inch ovenproof skillet over medium heat. Add onions and mushrooms and cook for 5 minutes, or until vegetables are soft. Add spinach and cook until wilted, about 1-2 minutes, Pour the egg mixture over the vegetables in the skillet. Cook for a couple of minutes just until the edges start to set, Sprinkle the top with grated Parmesan cheese, Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for 8-10 minutes or until the center is set and the top is slightly golden brown, Remove from oven and let the frittata sit for a couple of minutes. Cut into wedges and serve.

recipes.ingredients: 1 can (15 ounces) chickpeas, rinsed and drained, 1/2 cup diced cucumber, 1/2 cup diced red bell pepper, 1/4 cup chopped red onion, 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese (optional for vegan diets), 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 1 teaspoon dried oregano, Salt and pepper to taste, 4 whole-grain or low-carb tortillas
recipes.directions: In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, cucumber, bell pepper, red onion, and feta cheese if using. In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper. Pour the dressing over the chickpea mixture and toss until evenly coated. Spread the chickpea salad onto the center of each tortilla, distributing evenly. Fold in the sides of the tortilla and roll it up tightly to enclose the filling. Wrap the prepared wraps in foil or parchment paper for easy on-the-go lunch options. Store in the refrigerator until ready to eat.

recipes.recipe_name: Spinach and Mushroom Egg White Frittata
recipes.ingredients: 1 cup fresh spinach, chopped, 1 cup mushrooms, sliced, 1/2 cup onions, diced, 1 teaspoon olive oil, 4 egg whites, 1/4 cup low-fat milk, 1/4 teaspoon salt, Ground black pepper, to taste, 1/4 cup reduced-fat feta cheese, crumbled, Fresh herbs (such as parsley or chives), for garnish
recipes.directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a non-stick, oven-proof skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onions and mushrooms, and cook until the onions are translucent and the mushrooms have released their moisture, about 5-7 minutes, Stir in the chopped spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes, In a bowl, whisk together the egg whites, milk, salt, and pepper. Pour this mixture over the sautéed vegetables in the skillet, Sprinkle the top with crumbled feta cheese, Place the skillet in the oven and bake for 8-10 minutes, or until the frittata is set and the cheese has melted, Remove from the oven, garnish with fresh herbs, slice, and serve while warm.

recipes.ingredients: 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 3 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tablespoon fresh rosemary, finely chopped, 1 tablespoon fresh thyme, finely chopped, 1 tablespoon fresh parsley, finely chopped, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, Lemon wedges for garnish
recipes.directions: In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, minced garlic, rosemary, thyme, parsley, salt, and black pepper to create the marinade. Place chicken breasts in a large zip-top plastic bag and pour the marinade over the chicken. Seal the bag and ensure that chicken is well coated. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or up to 4 hours, turning the bag occasionally, Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. Remove the chicken from the marinade and discard the excess marinade. Grill the chicken until it is cooked through and internal temperature reaches 165°F, about 5-7 minutes per side, depending on thickness, Serve the grilled chicken breasts with lemon wedges on the side. Garnish with additional fresh herbs, if desired.

recipes.recipe_name: Grilled Chicken Salad with Avocado Dressing
recipes.ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 teaspoon smoked paprika, Salt and pepper, to taste, 6 cups mixed salad greens, 1 cucumber, sliced, 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved, 1/2 red onion, thinly sliced, 1 avocado, 1/4 cup Greek yogurt, 2 tablespoons lime juice, 1 clove garlic, minced, 1 tablespoon fresh cilantro, chopped, 2 tablespoons water, to thin
recipes.directions: Preheat grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. Rub the chicken breasts with olive oil, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper. Grill the chicken for 6-7 minutes on each side or until fully cooked. Let it rest for a few minutes, then slice, In a blender, combine avocado, Greek yogurt, lime juice, garlic, cilantro, and water. Blend until smooth, adding more water if necessary to reach a dressing-like consistency. Season the dressing with salt and pepper to taste, Arrange the mixed greens, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, and red onion on plates. Top with the grilled chicken slices. Drizzle with the avocado dressing and serve immediately.

recipes.recipe_name: Grilled Lemon-Herb Chicken and Veggie Kabobs
recipes.ingredients: 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into 1 1/2-inch pieces, 2 zucchinis, cut into 1-inch slices, 2 bell peppers, any color, cut into 1-inch pieces, 1 large red onion, cut into 1-inch pieces, 2 tablespoons olive oil, Juice of 1 lemon, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 teaspoon dried oregano, 1 teaspoon dried thyme, 1/2 teaspoon dried rosemary, Salt and pepper, to taste, Fresh parsley, chopped for garnish, Lemon wedges, to serve
recipes.directions: In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, thyme, rosemary, salt, and pepper. Place the chicken pieces in a bowl and pour half of the marinade over the chicken. Toss to coat and let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes. Reserve the remaining marinade for vegetables, Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Thread the marinated chicken, zucchini, bell peppers, and red onion onto skewers, alternating chicken and vegetables. Brush the vegetable parts of the skewers with the reserved marinade, Place the skewers on the grill and cook for approximately 10-15 minutes, turning occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender and lightly charred, Remove from grill, sprinkle with chopped parsley, and serve with lemon wedges on the side.

recipes.ingredients: 6 large eggs, 1/4 cup skim milk, 1/2 cup diced bell peppers, 1/2 cup diced onions, 1 cup chopped spinach, 1/2 cup chopped mushrooms, 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper, 2 tablespoons olive oil
recipes.directions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). In a large mixing bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, salt, and pepper until well combined. Stir in bell peppers, onions, spinach, mushrooms, and feta cheese. Heat olive oil in a 10-inch oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Add the egg mixture to the skillet and cook for 5-7 minutes until the edges begin to firm up. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the frittata is fully set and the top is lightly golden. Remove from oven, let it cool for a few minutes, then slice and serve.
